result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard E Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Def is in compliance w/ his bond, he has appeared for all CRT appearances.  His S.W. is present

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt:
3:04 pm Def in court w/ Atty N. Passe  Def in custody.  Emily E. Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. T. Huh.  Daniella Nelles-social worker.
Court:  Dr.'s report states that Mr. Smith is competent.  State no obj.  Passe went over the report with Mr. Smith and he's in agreement with it.  He's always thought he was competent.  Huh in agreement.  COURT will receive the report of Dr. Garcia.  Finds that Mr. Smith has regained competency for the reasons set forth in the Dr.'s report.  Nelles hasn't seen Dr. Garcia's report.  Court explains that he's to take his meds and stay sober from alcohol, drugs and prescription abuse.  Nelles says she was administering his meds during the week.  I'll continue to do that.  He's not on a CH 51 so I can't force him to take meds.  Court:  It would be a condition of bond tha the take meds as prescribed.  I'd also intend to add a JS requirement.  Huh would represent him from this point on.  Passe:  Richard states he lives on French Island and transportation may be a challenge.  Court:  As to alcohol, we could do ETG testing and that's no every day.  $2,500 sig bond; No alcohol or controlled subsances w/o Rx from a Dr.  No bars or taverns.  Comply with JS for testing.  Take all meds as prescribed.  Comply with the other recommendations of the community support program.  No contact with Jennifer Gudgeon or Brandon Slawson.
PH:  9/30 at 11 am  RAG
Ad Prosequendum - signed by SLH

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: For Treatment (Incompetency) - for an indeterminate term not to exceed 12 months signed by SLH

3:44 PM - Defendant Richard E Smith in court w/ Advesary counsel Nick Passey. Prosecuting Atty Michelle Ann Keller appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Passe: He's been approved for Siennea Hall Placement and should be able to get there next week. We want to admit that he is not comp but likely to regain w/ a referral to the out pt comp restoration program. 
Keller: that is reasonable and no objection. I talked to Dr. Engen today and she indicated that she believes it will be a reasonable plan. Referral to the out pt comp restoration program is approp. 
Crt: I have to commit to the dep't and they make the referral to the program.
Passe: that's correct. You make the order committing him to the dept making the referral to the program and then he's admitted to Sienna house and Daniella could be talking to the forensic unit to determine if he's an approp candidate and if he's not approp then he's under the commitment to the dept and they would then put him in Mendota or something like it. He's agreeing to the med order
Def: that's right. 
Crt: if you fail to meet the expectations in the program a ltr is submitted to the court and if so I have to commit you to one of the institutions. Will accept Dr. Engen's June report finding that he's not currently comp but likely to regain if committed for trmt purposes w/in the statutory time frame. Basis for court ordered meds given his psychiatric state. Orders that he be committed to the dept for a period not to exceed 12 mos w/ credit for 1 day. Def will be ref'd to out pt comp restoration program. If not accepted by the program, he's to be placed in a facility recommended by the dept. He has conditions as outline in the order.

Def w/atty Huh & Passe as adversary counsel
CRT: report find that he is not competent at this time but should be within the time frame of the case.
Passe: asking for a few wks
CRT: get a date
Competency hearing on July 30, 2014 at 03:45 pm.
Christina Engen
Christina Engen
